body_html:
The file is now available at https://storage.googleapis.com/download.tensorflow.org/models/inception_v3_2016_08_28_frozen.pb.tar.gz

To figure out the node names to use, try the summarize_graph tool:
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/tree/master/tensorflow/tools/graph_transforms#inspecting-graphs

This will tell you the input and output names, and the --print_structure flag will give you a full listing of all the nodes. If you look for the inputs to the final output node, you should be able to figure out the right layer name. If not, paste the output here and I can take a look.
body_text:

To figure out the node names to use, try the summarize_graph tool:
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/tree/master/tensorflow/tools/graph_transforms#inspecting-graphs
This will tell you the input and output names, and the --print_structure flag will give you a full listing of all the nodes. If you look for the inputs to the final output node, you should be able to figure out the right layer name. If not, paste the output here and I can take a look.
body:
The file is now available at https://storage.googleapis.com/download.tensorflow.org/models/inception_v3_2016_08_28_frozen.pb.tar.gz

To figure out the node names to use, try the summarize_graph tool:
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/tree/master/tensorflow/tools/graph_transforms#inspecting-graphs

This will tell you the input and output names, and the `--print_structure` flag will give you a full listing of all the nodes. If you look for the inputs to the final output node, you should be able to figure out the right layer name. If not, paste the output here and I can take a look.
